title: BCNF
subject: Database Management Systems
theory:
A relation is in BCNF if for every dependency X -> Y, X is a **Super Key**. 
Handles cases where Candidate Key components overlap.

interview_questions.question: Difference between 3NF and BCNF?
interview_questions.answer: 3NF allows dependency X->A if A is part of a Candidate Key. BCNF does not. BCNF is stricter.

exam_notes: Dependency Preserving not guaranteed in BCNF.
